statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Loyola Marymount 83, CS Bakersfield 75
article.story: LOS ANGELES (AP) -- Matthew Knight scored a season-high 26 points and had 16 rebounds and Brandon Worthy added 19 points to lead Loyola Marymount to a 83-75 victory over Cal State Bakersfield Sunday. Knight and Worthy combined to score the Lions' first 15 points of the second-half, propelling LMU (3-1) to a 53-37 lead with 13:21 remaining. The Roadrunners rallied and cut the Lions' lead to 78-71 with 1:01 left on Dwan Rice's basket, but Cal State Bakersfield couldn't close the gap any further. Knight made 8-of-14 shots and Worthy made 6-of-11 shots. Both players dished out four assists each. John Ziri added 12 points and nine rebounds for LMU. The Lions out-rebounded Cal State Bakersfield 46-35. Richard Andrews, who fouled out with 1:39 left in the game, led the Roadrunners with 19 points. Trent Blakley Rice and Dwan added 15 and 14 points, respectively, for Cal State Bakersfield (0-3). Dwan also had eight assists. The Roadrunners are a provisional Division I team this season after competing at the Division II level for the past 35 years. They haven't defeated a Division I team since beating Southeastern Louisiana during the 1986-87 season.
